Reviews.Title: A great Kodak camera!
Reviews.Author: Ryanst
Reviews.Content: My first digital camera was a Kodak DX6440, which was a fantastic camera back in it's day (2003). After the Kodak, I had a Fuji J20, which I was very unhappy with; very noticeable vignetting (dark corners) with all of the pictures. I decided to go back to Kodak and so I purchased the M530. Very happy with it! The feel of it, the image quality, user interface is all very very good.Pictures are incredibly crisp, clear and accurate for a sub $100 camera. The smart capture mode works very well too and is reliable.There are a few minor annoyances though. One, the camera doesn't remember which mode to start up in. It automatically defaults to smart capture every time the camera is turned on. This is somewhat irritating since you aren't likely leave the camera on for a long time between shots, and if you want to take pictures with more manual control, you will need to select the mode you want every time the camera is started up. Luckily, the user interface is pretty well designed though where you don't need to hit a dozen buttons to do what you want to do.Two, the auto white balance can be somewhat unreliable. I find that colors either turn out too cool (blueish tint) or too warm (redish tint), although some shots turn out perfectly. The problem seems to be exacerbated when taking pictures of landscapes. The angle of the sun also affects the white balance selection. Turn towards the sun and you may get different colors than you get turning away from the sun. I would say the auto mode gets it right about 70% of the time.Lastly, because this camera uses a very inexpensive lens, there is some minor light falloff present in some of the pictures. I find that it is only noticable when the sky takes up a large part of the scene in the picture. You'll notice a very gradual darkening as you move towards the two upper corners. The problem is minor though, and for most people it shouldn't be a problem. I, however, find it annoying.Overall though, this camera is a fantastic buy. I highly recommend it for anyone looking for a cheap, yet decent quality point and shoot.

Reviews.Title: Great Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: C. McCay
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It is compact, comes in cute colors, has a vivid screen and takes crisp, clear pictures. I'm no professional, but for an on the go college student this has surely passed the test. It outshines my old camera (a samsung) and I have yet to get a blurry picture, even when taking shots of mountains while driving at 60 mph. The new share function on the new Kodak line is awesome as well! One small thing I also ended up liking alot was the small grip area (the greyish black part on the side); makes the already light camera super easy to hold. Amazing fast face recognition too. Overall, two thumbs up if you're looking for an easy to use camera that takes awesome pictures!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare M530
Reviews.Author: D. Smith "exchanger"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this camera for my mother. She loves the easy operation. She has no trouble saving the pictures to computer and sharing.

Reviews.Title: Produces nice photos and keeps charge
Reviews.Author: H. Haddock
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this camera to anyone who's not a photographing professional and only wants to capture moments.  I've had cameras with batteries and they can never take more than a few photos.  I finally decided to get a camera with built-in battery.  I'm so glad that I did!  The picture quality is good.  It takes decent videos, too.  Finding the functions takes a bit getting used to.  Once you know how to work it, it's great for the price.  For my purpose, I am very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Simple Cam easy to use
Reviews.Author: RodrigoS "Ro-Ro"
Reviews.Content: WE bought this camera for our daughter and it is really easy to use and simple.Good zoom, size and pictures quality.Higly recommended

Reviews.Title: ideal camera
Reviews.Author: shelly
Reviews.Content: The Kodak 530 easyshare is my first digital camera and i am pleased to say that I am happy that I bought it.All my pictures taken so far are satisfactory and its very easy to understand the features.I will definitely recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Small Camera 12MP does Large Job
Reviews.Author: Ronnie Bee "Ronnie Bee"
Reviews.Content: Amateur photographers on vacation will love this camera; it not for the Pro crowd, but it takes great pictures, with very little effort.Ronnie Bee

Reviews.Title: Bleah
Reviews.Author: yair
Reviews.Content: Pros: Cheap.Cons: Low quality, terrible design.I really dislike this camera. A small sampling of my frustrations: poor picture quality generally (especially in low light.. and in any light I've generally gotten much better photos out of other cameras with similarly cheap optics and much lower megapixels), awkward menus (for example just deleting one bad photo is awkward enough that I got in a habit which soon led me to, with one extra accidental click, perhaps irretrievably wiping the entire SD card... despite supposed "protect" features which themselves are unusually problematic to use and perhaps just outright buggy...), insistence on downloading and installing Kodak's annoyingly cutesy and proprietary software when I just want a quick charge or card read (which was especially problematic when traveling between PCs, sometimes with poor internet connections).I really wish I had paid a few bucks more for a non-Kodak camera with better picture taking, more optical zoom, and less problematic software.

Reviews.Title: would be good if it didn't eat batteries
Reviews.Author: katherine
Reviews.Content: I've had this about a year. At first it was good. Then the battery wouldn't hold a charge. So I bought a new one. It lasted about 2 months, i didn't use it very much either. Won't hold a charge or even take 1 picture now...

Reviews.Title: KODAK EASY SHARE M530
Reviews.Author: Chrystal "-Chrys"
Reviews.Content: Kodak Easy Share is just the title..... It is easy to share your pics.. I <3 this camera and I think so will you! I actually have the black camera instead of the blue, but they all work the same. You will love it! <3

Reviews.Title: Loving it!
Reviews.Author: Curlygirliediy
Reviews.Content: I am so glad I got this camera it makes the annoyance of replacing the crappy Polaroid one worth while should have just gotten this one in the first place. It is extremely easy to use. There are 4 buttons on the side of the screen for various things so that you don't have to go through a crazy menu to get to what you need. The buttons on the top also bring up nice neat menus in which you can change the scene setting and picture quality very easily. It plays back sound on video I only tried it once and I was alone it didn't sound that great but there really wasn't much to hear so hopefully its better than what I think, which is still better than the no sound I got from my old easyshare. The lens isn't as loud when it comes on or goes off as my old one either. Its a cute color and a great size. It is a small camera and not heavy so dropping it would probably do some type of damage to the body it does have a lanyard included so i would suggest you use it to prevent accidents. When you are taking a picture and looking through the lcd you will notice that it is a bit fuzzy but as soon as you snap the pic it will be clear and sharp for review and uploading as well. The share feature from the software is very easy to use. If you are using facebook you will have the option to create a new album or add to an existing one. I was concerned about having to charge it up rather than use regular batteries because I am used to batteries and they are easy to replace, but so far no problems the battery seems to hold the charge for a while but I have only had this for about a week. Anyway it takes great pictures, i have gotten excellent snow pics and pics of my betta with this.

Reviews.Title: great gift
Reviews.Author: Nana Kandy
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my grandson.  He loves it.  Takes great pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: it's fun to share!
Reviews.Author: nellenot "nellenot"
Reviews.Content: love this phone, it is soooo easy to use. takes standard sd card which is nice, no special equipment to buy. just point - shoot - and share.  the reason i gave it 4 stars is because i had to go to kodak site to download software, otherwise this camera is great1

Reviews.Title: Decent point and shoot
Reviews.Author: stephanie windham
Reviews.Content: This is a decent point and shoot camera. I'm used to a professional camera, and got this for my son to teach him the basics of taking photos. If I take an indoor photo without the flash it comes out a little blurry. I haven't had a lot of luck with changing settings. I hate using the flash, and I never use it on my pro camera. This is a good camera if you just need to take basic photos and upload them. I bought it used for a good price, and I can't complain.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good Little camera!
Reviews.Author: Kenny McDaniel
Reviews.Content: Great Camera Bought it a few years ago and I still use and it works great still! love the camera takes pretty good pictures!

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera.
Reviews.Author: richard
Reviews.Content: Thank all of you for your great services. I am really pleased with the merchandise. The camera works well. Have a great day. Thanks again for all that you do.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: luv 2 shop!
Reviews.Content: Great little camera for the price. Small and lightweight, good for the novice picture takers. I would buy this for a gift!

Reviews.Title: Dont waste your money
Reviews.Author: choirdirector1
Reviews.Content: Not a good buy, it wont hold a charge and the charger has a short in it, worked for about 6 months then the problems started. Thought the battery was dead brought another one( Amazon Great service) the camera wouldnt hold the charge, the pictures that i have, im trying to download to my computer so i can dump this camera. My advice, avoid this !!

Reviews.Title: It was good, but it didn't last very long
Reviews.Author: Ughhhh
Reviews.Content: We registered for this camera when we got married because it was a great start up camera for taking a lot of pictures and wanting to share them. And most importantly, it had a rechargeable battery.  About a month after we got married, the lid to the battery compartment broke. The camera was in the case, in my purse and when I took it out the lid was popped open and broken. Fine. We held it down with duct tape.About 6 months after that, the camera unexpectedly dies while I am in the middle of taking a picture at a party. I open up the battery case and the little tab that holds the battery down to complete the charge has broken. Fine. I put a piece of paper in there to hold tension.Two months after that, the camera is in my purse in the car and a fountain drink spills. The camera gets wet (not soaked by any means, and not even all over wet) and it never turned on again. Now, spilling Coke on a camera is not my intended use, and sucks no matter what, but that still doesn't explain why it was made from the cheapest plastic known to man.As far as pictures, they're fine. Although there's some file glitch where a picture will save and then later tell you it's an "unrecognizable file format" and then that picture is just GONE. It is also way easy to "delete all" and there is no undelete. This is especially true in bright sunlight when the screen is basically unreadable.It won't hold your settings when you turn it off, so if you are taking several pictures in low light, be prepared to leave the camera on or reset your setting every time.The software is cool. The smart capture works reasonably well, although the camera freezes up, a lot.I would not buy again. Looking at getting a Nikon now. But it was fun while it lasted. Except for the duct tape.

Reviews.Title: It's cute. I like it thank you!
Reviews.Author: Danica Loy
Reviews.Content: thank you for the fast delivery and the product, after trying it out. I adore this little camera. It takes wonderful pictures.  I'm still getting familiar with switching quickly back and forth from video to camera mode but the only other critique I have is that whenever I turn it on, and sometimes while I am recording video footage the camera tends to make a small clicking noise. I don't know if it's supposed to do that or what but other than that there doesn't seem to be anything wrong with it. I look forward to using more.

Reviews.Title: Great digital camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Patricia A. Gilbert
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for our upcoming trip. It was the perfect size for in our bag. It takes great pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Feels Cheap
Reviews.Author: SimTechGuy
Reviews.Content: Item recieved promptly, but feels cheaply made.  Have not used it as of yet.  This will be a gift so more to come later as she tries it out.

Reviews.Title: not as good as expected
Reviews.Author: srj "srj"
Reviews.Content: Many of the photos came out blurry, but others are fine.  Not sure if it's any better than the older, cheaper Kodak I normally use.

ProductInfo.Features:
12-megapixel resolution for stunning prints up to 30 x 40 inches
3x optical zoom
2.7-inch LCD with KODAK Color Science Technology
Kodak's Smart Capture feature; Face Recognition feature
Capture images to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare M530 12 MP Digital Camera with 3x Wide Angle Optical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Blue)
